content.body: Watcher is about notifying "something may be going on with something in this set of things that I care about", and then letting you (later) access that going-on subset. I haven't heard of a pub-sub thing with a requirement like that. Using the signals directly to represent themselves, as opposed to a subscription object, saves lots of allocations in a hot path. And there's no payload--also unusual for pub/sub systems (since you get the payload by reading the computed, and computeds are not pub/sub)
